titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid to the Smith College publications and publications records CA.MS.01006
titlestmt.author: Madison White

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-07-22 12:49:21 -0400.

change.item: Finding aid updated as part of the College Archives Survey

did.unittitle: Smith College publications and publications records
did.abstract: Publications records consist of pamphlets, brochures, booklets, transparencies, college calendars, directory catalogue, faculty and staff publications, admission marketing material, publicity materials and programs for major college-wide events (such as Rally Day), the Smith Alumnae Quarterly, The Alumnae Register, the Smith College Catalogue, The Annual Report of the President of Smith College and Meridians.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials in the Smith College Archives are open for use, with the following exceptions: "Office Files," files of records created for the use of the administrative unit that created them, are closed to research for a period of 10 years following their creation. In all cases, the College Archives will continue to provide public access to materials that were intended to be public at the time of their creation (press releases, publications, etc.)

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: These materials were transferred to College Archives in 1986, 1991, 2008, and 2018.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Publications are produced by the College Relations staff and range from brochures and booklets to large-scale projects such as the admission viewbook and the Smith Alumnae Quarterly. The focus is external (off-campus) college relations.

The Smith Alumnae Quarterly has been published from 1909 to present. Meridians has been published from 2000 to present. The Alumnae Register is published every 3 years, from 1893 to present. The Annual Report of the President of Smith College has been published from 1875-present. The Smith College Catalogue has been published from 1915-present.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: The collection has container lists that are available upon request by contacting specialcollections@smith.edu

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Smith College publications and publications records, Smith College Archives, CA-MS-01006, Smith College Special Collections, Northampton, Massachusetts.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Some book publications are unboxed and grouped by title on the shelves. 'Faculty, Staff and Student publications' have been pulled from other collections and placed in 40 record cartons. The 5 boxes of college publications/pamphlets in West Street are the result of culling and organizing by title. The rest of the material is organized in folders in document boxes that are primarily arranged alphabetically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Publications records consist of pamphlets, brochures, booklets, transparencies, college calendars, directory catalogue, faculty and staff publications, admission marketing material, publicity materials and programs for major college-wide events (such as Rally Day), the Smith Alumnae Quarterly, The Alumnae Register, the Smith College Catalogue, The Annual Report of the President of Smith College and Meridians.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Smith College retains copyright of materials created as part of its business operations; however, copyright in other items in this collection may be held by their respective creators. For reproductions of materials that are governed by fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. For instances which may regard materials in the collection not created by Smith College, researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from Smith College Special Collections to move forward with their use.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Please note that prior to 2018, folder inventories were not always updated when new material was added to the collection. As a result, folder inventories may not be complete and folder numbers may be incorrect.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Until we move into New Neilson in early 2021, collections are stored in multiple locations and may take up to 48 hours to retrieve. Researchers are strongly encouraged to contact Special Collections (specialcollections@smith.edu) at least a week in advance of any planned visits so that boxes may be retrieved for them in a timely manner.

did.unittitle: Administrative files of Meridians: A Journal of Feminism, Race, and Transnationalism

physdesc.extent: (3 record cartons, 1 regular document box, 1/2 regular document box, 1 oversize box. Digital media are in box 1.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Business files related to the administration and production of the journal Meridians, a joint venture between Smith College and published by Indiana University Press.

did.unittitle: Computer media: 1 CD and 2 3.5 floppy disks
Meridians style sheet and submission guidelines
When and Where I Enter event
"Women, Girls and HIV/AIDS in Africa and the African Diaspora" conference, Spelman College
Kahn Institute session on trafficking notes
National Women's Studies Association/Women of Color Caucus website
Meridians Symposium: State of the Field

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Smith College archived websites includes the official college website, news, and social media managed by the Office of College Relations. Additional web content is added to the archive on a regular basis. Once the initial capture of a website is completed, periodic captures are conducted as long as the site is active.
